MainApp Views

mainapp.views.addBook(request, *args, **kwargs)

Processes the request to add a new book

Parameters:

request – HttpRequest - The request object

mainapp.views.addUserBook(request, *args, **kwargs)

Adds a new book to the user’s library

Parameters:

  • request – HttpRequest - The request object

  • book – Book - The book to add to the user’s library

mainapp.views.approve_borrow_request(request, *args, **kwargs)

View function to approve a borrow request for a book.

Parameters:

  • request – HttpRequest - The request object

  • book_id – int - The ID of the book to approve the borrow request for

mainapp.views.borrow(request, *args, **kwargs)

Combined function to handle both initiating a borrow request and saving booking details.

Parameters:

  • request – HttpRequest - The request object

  • user_book_id – int - The ID of the user book to borrow

Renders the chat page

Parameters:

request – HttpRequest - The request object

mainapp.views.decrement_counter(request, *args, **kwargs)

Decrements the notification counter for the user

Parameters:

request – HttpRequest - The request object

mainapp.views.deny_borrow_request(request, *args, **kwargs)

View function to deny a borrow request for a book.

Parameters:

  • request – HttpRequest - The request object

  • book_id – int - The ID of the book to deny the borrow request for

mainapp.views.display_pic(request, *args, **kwargs)

Displays the user’s profile picture

Parameters:

request – HttpRequest - The request object

mainapp.views.get_pre_message_content(request, user)

Retrieves the pre-message content for the user

Parameters:

  • request – HttpRequest - The request object

  • user – User - The user object

mainapp.views.img_upload(request, *args, **kwargs)

Handles the image upload functionality

Parameters:

request – HttpRequest - The request object

mainapp.views.load_full_conversation(request, *args, **kwargs)

This function loads the full conversation between two users, ensuring the user is logged in.

Parameters: request (HttpRequest): The Django HttpRequest object. conversation_id (int): The ID of the conversation between the two users.

Returns: HttpResponse: Renders the conversation page with the messages between the two users.

mainapp.views.login_required_message(function)

Decorator to display a message if the user is not logged in

Parameters:

function – function

mainapp.views.login_view(request)

Processes the request to log in a user

Parameters:

request – HttpRequest - The request object

mainapp.views.mark_all_as_read(request, *args, **kwargs)

Marks all notifications as read for the user

Parameters:

request – HttpRequest - The request object

Renders the about page

Parameters:

request – HttpRequest - The request object

mainapp.views.new_conv(request, *args, **kwargs)

View function to start a new conversation with another user, ensuring the user is logged in.

Parameters: :param request: The Django HttpRequest object.

request – HttpRequest - The request object

mainapp.views.new_profile(request, *args, **kwargs)

mainapp.views.notify_user(request, *args, **kwargs)

Notifies the user with a message

Parameters:

  • request – HttpRequest - The request object

  • message – str - The message to send

mainapp.views.rate_user(request, conversation_id)

This function allows a user to rate another user after a conversation has ended.

Parameters: :param request: The Django HttpRequest object. :param conversation_id: The ID of the conversation between the two users.

Returns: :return Redirects to the conversation page after the rating is submitted.

mainapp.views.redirect_notification(request, *args, **kwargs)

Marks notification as read and redirects the user to the appropriate page for the notification type.

Parameters:

  • request – HttpRequest - The request object

  • notification_id – int - The ID of the notification to redirect

Parameters:

request – HttpRequest - The request object

Removes a book from the user’s library

request – HttpRequest - The request object

mainapp.views.request_return_book(request, *args, **kwargs)

View function to request return a book.

Parameters:

  • request – HttpRequest - The request object

  • book_id – int - The ID of the book to return

mainapp.views.return_book(request, *args, **kwargs)

View function to return a book.

Parameters:

  • request – HttpRequest - The request object

  • book_id – int - The ID of the book to return

mainapp.views.search(request, *args, **kwargs)

Renders the search page and handles search functionality

Parameters:

request – HttpRequest - The request object

mainapp.views.send_message(request, *args, **kwargs)

This function handles the POST request to send a message from one user to another, ensuring the user is logged in.

Parameters:

  • request – The Django HttpRequest object.

  • conversation_id – The ID of the conversation between the two users.

Returns:

HttpResponse: Redirects to the conversation page after the message is sent or error message if failed.

mainapp.views.updateProfile(request, *args, **kwargs)

Updates the user’s profile

Parameters:

request – HttpRequest - The request object

mainapp.views.view_profile(request, *args, **kwargs)

Renders the user profile page for a specific user

Parameters:

  • request – HttpRequest - The request object

  • profile_id – int - The ID of the user profile to view
